## Case Western Reserve University

<img src="project_1_banner.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain" onclick="window.open('https://abbottlab480702554.wordpress.com/', 'blank');"/>

Most of my current work at CWRU is related to butterfly thermal physiology. I study species physiological tolerances to determine their vulnerability to climate change.

Learn more about my work in this video!
{{< video https://youtu.be/3MhYFhAQwO4 aspect-ratio="4x3" >}}

Thanks to my great CWRU advisors Dr. Karen Abbott and Dr. Jean Burns!

## John Carroll University

<img src="project_2_banner.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain" onclick="window.open('https://jamesiwatling.wordpress.com/', 'blank');"/>

At JCU I studied thermal physiology and population decline of the tropical salamander Bolitoglossa altamazonica in Colombia. 

Learn more about our work in Colombia in this video:
{{< video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=58nH1bYV26s&t=1s aspect-ratio="4x3" >}}

Thanks to my awesome JCU advisor Dr. James Watling!
